citeinfo.origin: Thorleifur Einarsson, University Research Institute, Reykjavik and David M. Hopkins and Richard R. Doell, U.S. Geological Survey, Menlo Park, California.
citeinfo.title: The Stratigraphy of Tjornes, Northern Iceland and the History of the Bering Land Bridge

abstract.p: Recent studies of the upper Pliocene and Pleistocene rock sequences of Iceland contributes to knowledge of the history of land bridges and sea passages in the Bering sea area and also cast light on several other aspects of the history of the Pleistocene Epoch.

[Reference: Einarsson, Thorleifus, Hopkins, D.M., and Doell, R.R., 1967, The stratigraphy of Tjï¿¶rnes, northern Iceland, and the history of the Bering Land Bridge, in Hopkins, D.M., ed., 1967, The Bering Land Bridge, Stanford University Press, Stanford, Calif., p. 312-325.]

descript.purpose: Collected data on the Tjornes, Northern Iceland and the History of the Bering Land Bridge.
